edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.nodeconfig

Class GNSNodeConfig<NodeIDType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.nodeconfig.GNSNodeConfig<NodeIDType>
  • Type Parameters:
    NodeIDType -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    GNSInterfaceNodeConfig<NodeIDType>, Shutdownable, edu.umass.cs.nio.interfaces.NodeConfig<NodeIDType>, edu.umass.cs.nio.interfaces.Stringifiable<NodeIDType>, edu.umass.cs.nio.nioutils.InterfaceDelayEmulator<NodeIDType>, edu.umass.cs.reconfiguration.interfaces.ReconfigurableNodeConfig<NodeIDType>

    public class GNSNodeConfig<NodeIDType>
extends Object
implements GNSInterfaceNodeConfig<NodeIDType>, Shutdownable, edu.umass.cs.nio.nioutils.InterfaceDelayEmulator<NodeIDType>
    This class maintains information that allows different nodes to communicate with each other. It parses a hosts file to gather information about each name server in the system. Also has support for checking to see if the hosts file changes. When that happens the host info is reloaded and the ConsistentHashing.reInitialize method is called. Also contains an implementation of the Stringifiable interface which allows strings to be converted back to NodeIDTypes. This also implements InterfaceReconfigurableNodeConfig which entails a separation of the activeReplica and reconfigurator network ports. The current implementation maintains three NodeIds for each node that is read from the hosts file. A "top-level" id which is identical to the id read from the file, plus to additional ids. One for the activeReplica and one for the reconfigurator. See NodeInfo, addHostInfo and readHostsFile for the details on how those are generated. One caveat of the current implementation is that despite the use of NodeIDType throughout the code, we only currently support String NodeIDTypes in this class.
